IN THE NEWS: Tuberville slams Biden's proposed changes to Title IX
https://t.co/2qilYaJY0O
But, as the son of a veteran and a member of the Senate Committee on Veterans' Affairs, I'm willing to give the Senate a chance to improve the bill since our Committee did not have that chance. (4/4)

As it's written now, the bill will likely cost Americans at least a trillion dollars in the long run ‚Äì money our country does not have ‚Äì and result in significant delays in the delivery of VA care and benefits. (3/4)

Sen. Schumer bypassed the Senate's normal process of allowing the committee of jurisdiction ‚Äì the VA Committee, of which I'm a member ‚Äì to craft the bill and hash out issues, electing instead to bring the legislation straight to the floor without full committee input. (2/4)

I voted yes to allow the Senate to begin debating a bill that attempts to right size the VA's healthcare and benefits policies regarding veterans suffering from illnesses related to toxic exposure. But I have some concerns‚Ä¶ (1/4)

As we celebrate the 50th anniversary of #TitleIX this year, we must also call out blatant attempts to undermine protections for women and girls. The NCAA has dropped the ball by allowing the female sports divisions to include anyone, failing women & decimating fairness in sports.

Contrary to the media narrative, peer-reviewed studies confirm that reducing testosterone doesn't remove biological advantages.

Yet a biological man repeatedly swept female collegiate swim meets because @NCAA abandoned its responsibility to protect collegiate athletes.
